summary: This is an email chain from September 19, 2019, forwarding an urgent media inquiry from NBC News producer Sarah Fitzpatrick to the FBI. The inquiry seeks comment on allegations from an interview subject (redacted) who claims she was directed by Jeffrey Epstein to have sex with several prominent men, identified them to the FBI, and that an FBI agent was later told to stop investigating the case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure of the NBC News report; alleged to have directed a woman to engage in sexual activity with other men.

events.title: Alleged Sexual Abuse Period
events.description: A woman alleges she was directed by Jeffrey Epstein and/or his associates to engage in sexual activity with other men on multiple occasions in the US and abroad.

events.title: FBI Meeting in Australia
events.description: The interview subject met with the FBI in Australia, as reflected in emails reviewed by NBC News.

events.title: FBI Agent Claims Investigation Halted
events.description: An FBI agent allegedly told the interview subject via phone that 'his head had been cut off above him' and that he was instructed to stop investigating the Epstein case.

events.title: Planned NBC News Broadcast
events.description: NBC News planned to broadcast a report about Jeffrey Epstein on Dateline and other programs.

keyFacts: An NBC News producer requested urgent comment from the FBI regarding allegations that a woman was directed by Jeffrey Epstein to have sex with several prominent men from 2000-2002.
The woman identified the men as Alan Dershowitz, Bill Richardson, George Mitchell, Glenn Dubin, Jean-Luc Brunel, and Prince Andrew.
The woman claims she provided these names to the FBI during an interview and that an FBI agent later told her in 2014 he was instructed to stop investigating the Epstein case.
NBC News reviewed emails confirming the woman met with the FBI in Australia in 2011 and had subsequent correspondence.
The document highlights allegations of high-level connections and potential obstruction of the FBI's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
